Dear Ms. Hardin:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on March 15, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for
each child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal
and at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Four of eight foster care cases reviewed contained updated service plans that
were late and did not met the 90 calendar days required.
DHHS Policy 722-08D Required Signature.
Treatment plans Agreement and Signature:
Once completed and approved, the caseworker
must obtain signatures from the following
individuals, as applicable:
Foster parents, relative caregivers, and
unrelated court ordered caregivers.
Parents/legal guardians, youth, and caregivers
must check yes or no for the following when
signing the treatment plan: I have participated in
the development of the Case Service Plan and the
Parent Agency Treatment Plan.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 3 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. Interim
inspection report dated 05/18/2022 and special investigation reports
#2022C0420021 and SI#2022C0201004. Overall, the agency is doing well with
their CAP as they only had one repeat violation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was reviewed and discussed on-site.
The CAA was consistent with the findings of this evaluation. The agency has had
some difficulty with staffing this year but has continued to problem solve and
ensure appropriate staffing to manage cases effectively.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were identified.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site. Both staff reported a need for additional
staffing. However, both staff also reported feeling supported by the agency. Staff
stated supervisors and administrator are knowledgeable, helpful, and truly care
about them as individuals. Staff report the agency administrator and supervisors
provide solid direction and are flexible with work options, which helps maintain
work and life balance.
No youth were interviewed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space. File storage was viewed and found
to be secure.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was no safety concern.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that Catholic Charities of Southeast Michigan will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
